title: ISic001375. Epitaph
body:
Facsimile Images

[Ἐνθάδε? κεῖται?]
Δι̣ον[υσιc. 1 - 2 ζήσασ.]
ἀμέμπτω[ς ἔτη]
λε´ τελευτᾷ τ[ῇ πρ(ὸ) ---]
5νωνῶν Σε[πτ](εμβρίων) [ἡμέ-]
ρᾳ Κυρίου ἐ[ν εἰρήνῃ?]

Apparatus criticus

Text based on photograph; Kirchhoff, Korhonen: ἐνθάδε κεῖται
line.2: Traces of ΔΙ (or ΔΥ) on the stone registered also by Mavilla, Stevenson has ΔΙΟΝ.; Kirchhoff: [ζήσας ἔτη], Korhonen: [ζήσασ-]
line.3: Alessi: ΑΜΕΜΠΟΣ, Kirkchhoff, Kaibel, Wessel: ἄμεμπ[τ]ος; Ferrua, Korhonen: ἀμέμπτω[ς]; Kirchhoff: [καὶ ἄλυπ]|[ος], Ferrua: [ζήσασα ἔτη], Korhonen: ἀμέμπτω[ς ἔτη]
line.4: Alessi, Wessel: λκ; Kirchhoff does not register the numeral; Kaibel: λβ; Ferrua, Korhonen: λε; Kirchhoff, Kaibel, Wessel, Ferrua: τ[ῆι πρὸ -]; Korhonen: τ[ῇ πρ(ὸ) -]
line.5: Kirchhoff, Kaibel: Σε[πτεμβρίων]; Wessel: Σε[πτ. ἡμέρᾳ]; Korhonen: Σε[πτ(εμβρίων) ἡμε|ρᾷ]
line.6: Kirchhoff: κυρι[ακῇ ἡμέρᾷ]; Wessel: κυρίου; Korhonen: Κυρίου ἐ[ν εἰρήνῇ?]

English translation

Here lies(?) Dionysia/Dionysios, having lived blameless for 35 years. s/he died the [-] day before the nones of September, on the day of the Lord. In peace (?).

Italian translation

Qui giace(?) Dionysia/Dionysios, che visse in modo irreprensibile per 35 anni. Morì [-] giorni prima delle None di Settembre nel giorno del Signore. In pace (?).

commentary

The restoration of the ἐνθάδε κεῖται formula at l. 1 is highly probable since this is the most frequent structure in Christian epitaphs in Catania, followed by the participle of ζάω to express the age of the deceased and by the verb τελευτάω to specify the date of death (the examples without the ἐνθάδε κεῖται formula are rare and usually the name of the deceased follows the verb τελευτάω, as in IG 14.551 = ISic001370). Ferrua considers the deceased to be a woman and restores ζήσασα at l. 2, whereas Korhonen thinks he can identify the deceased with a Διονυσίος or Διονυσία because of the high frequency of these two names in Catania and indeed the space would fit these names. On the use of ἀμέμπτως ζῆν in the Christian epitaphs in Catania, see IMusCatania 208 = ISic003299, IMusCatania 212 = ISic000647 and Korhonen 2004: 111.

bibliography

  • 14.0556 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 181 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
  • 4.9499 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001252
  • 1053 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000394
  • Alessi 1833 230 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002538
  • Alessi 1833 174 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002540
  • Ferrua 1989 117 no.448 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001995
  • p. 111 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
